newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian fund assets rose 26 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Belgian fund assets rose 26 pct in 1996.

text.p: Assets under management at Belgian investment funds rose by 26 percent to 957.7 billion Belgian francs in 1996, the Belgian Investment Fund Association said in its annual report published on Monday.

Total assets of all investment funds sold in Belgium, including those based in neighbouring Luxembourg where many Belgian banks have specialist private banking subsidiaries, rose 15.7 percent to 2,253.8 billion francs from 1,948.0 billion.
Net new subscriptions to Belgian funds were 76.3 billion francs, up from 57.6 billion francs in 1995. Net new subscriptions to all funds sold in Belgium were 73.9 billion francs.
The biggest gains were in "click funds" -- funds guaranteeing initial capital and offering a return based on some underlying stock or other index.
Net investment in click funds (including foreign funds commercialised in Belgium) rose to 96.4 billion francs from 7.5 billion in 1995.
Funds linked to the performance of the Belgian stock market accounted for 25.8 billion francs of the net total. Those linked to other stock markets, 54.8 billion francs.
In contrast, the fall in market interest rates in Europe produced a net outflow of investments from long-term bond (down 3.9 billion francs) and money market (down 42.5 billion francs) funds.
However, medium-term bond funds, with a duration of six months to three years, saw a net inflow of 4.5 billion francs.
